comment:
Best professor at KSU. This man could teach calculus to an earthworm.  

Do whatever you can to get one of his courses. Go on the waitlist. Watch OwlExpress 24/7 during add/drop. You won't regret it. GOAT.

He is a great professor take him, there's no reason you shouldn't be taking him if he has available seats. He's such a chill guy, pay attention to the definitions and examples done in class you will surely do well. So overall, as long as you pay attention in class and do the homework, you will do well 100%.

UFC 400: PROFESSOR RYAN WILSON VS. PROFESSOR LEONARD.

WHO IS THE GREATEST MATH PROFESSOR IN THE UNIVERSE? FIND OUT SOON! (ITS PROBABLY RYAN)!

One of my favorite Math teachers I've had. Would 100% recommend. He was great at explaining where formulas come from, how to find them, and how and when to use them. No notes or anything online so you must be in class or get notes from a friend. I would also like to add he seemed to be a generous grader, which is always nice!

By far the best math prof I've seen. Homework was a standard amount, and fairly easy. weekly quizzes so be prepared, but if you do the homework you will be prepared, and almost every quiz had a worksheet we went over immediately before. tests were really easy after doing everything else, and even if you struggle he is great at answering questions.
The best professor I have ever had. Made an account just to tell you to take his class if possible.

You would be lucky to get Dr. Wilson. He is very passionate about the content which makes it very easy to stay engaged. I attribute my decent grade to his teaching (and actually doing the HW/practice). The only thing that held me back from an A was my lack of applying myself nearer to the end of the semester. He made a weed-out class enjoyable.

Dr. Wilson is a great professor who really helps you understand the material. His lectures are clear and useful, and he provides helpful worksheets to prepare for weekly quizzes and exams. Staying on top of ALEKS is important for success. There are three exams throughout the semester plus a final. Would definitely recommend him!

He's really good and knows what he's talking about. Calc 2 is difficult but he is very understanding and accessible outside class. There is a good amount of homework due every week as well as a quiz on what the homework is about. 4 exams and a final, lowest grade gets dropped. Only thing is his tests are way harder than hw, practices and quizzes.

Dr. Wilson was amazing! His lectures were easy to follow and he would always answer any questions we had. He was thorough and I think he did a great job of teaching the material. He also had office hours in case we needed additional help. I really recommend taking him!

I wish there were 10 more Professor Wilsons at KSU. He's easily one of the best math instructors I've had. He's well-spoken and attentive. The class is consisted of 4 exams, a final, weekly quizzes and HW, with tests and most quizzes being taken during the 2nd class of the week. He also provides plenty of worksheets and study guides for practice.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: This is the first math class since like, freshman year of high school where I could follow along and actually understand the content being taught in class. He explains things in a manner which makes sense, and gives background to certain concepts in order to give a good foundation of the new stuff. Highly recommend.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. Wilson changed Calculus 2 for me. I've failed this class before and I know I can definitely pass his class. He explains things so so well and everything was immediately clearer. I'm so grateful to him!
GREATEST MATH PROFESSOR OF ALL TIME. DROP WHATEVER TEACHER YOU HAVE AND TAKE THIS LEGEND.

Taken for 2345 (Discrete Math). Prof. Wilson is the first math professor I've ever had that let me legitimately enjoy the subject. His way of teaching is intuitive and very engaging. Graded by 4 exams with lowest replaced by the final. Sometimes there is extra credit. Weekly quizzes are open note! Amazing professor - recommended for all!
W professor. Take him if you want to learn and to pass
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Ryan does a great job ensuring that everyone understands the content and creates an environment where it is easy to ask questions. He takes multiple approaches to each subject to make sure you really understand what you're learning. Overall he is super friendly and caring and I definitely recommend him

Great professor, super chill, and teaches really well. Attendance isn't mandatory, but you'll fail if you skip since he doesn't post notes online (writes everything on board). Homework isn't graded, but quizzes are based on it. You get 15 minutes to finish and can use your homework. Offers extra credit for exams.

(MATH 2345) He is very nice to everyone. Love to help you when you needed help with homework or preparing for test. Weekly homework and quizzes, but the quizzes are literally your homework and you can use it on the quiz. He is really fast with responding to email and will hop on zoom (even on a Sunday). Many extra credit opportunities were given.
